titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand the types of equipment which may be acquired with tax-exempt financing by volunteer fire departments and to provide a comparable treatment for emergency medical service organizations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means
House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 1/4/1995--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to permit the issuance of tax-exempt bonds by volunteer fire departments to acquire ambulances or other emergency response vehicles. Treats a volunteer emergency medical service organization as if it were a volunteer fire department and such services were firefighting services for purposes of the tax-exempt bond rules.
